intro: Senecio ovatus, commonly known as the silver leaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silver-white, woolly leaves and yellow daisy-like flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Senecio ovatus thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and easy care requirements.
